Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness, errors in law or fact in visa denial
Evidence_Assessment: Assessment of applicant's intent to immigrate, ties to Pakistan
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate unfairness or error
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's credibility regarding intent and ties to home country
Legal_Rule: Visa officers must follow procedural fairness and base decisions on evidence
Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of procedural fairness, use of extrinsic evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Perceived intent to immigrate, insufficient ties to Pakistan
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision found to adhere to procedural fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Ties to Pakistan, employment intent, immigration intent
Legal_Framework: Canadian Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of employment authorization based on alleged procedural unfairness and legal error
Defendant_Response: Decision supported by evidence and applied correct legal standards
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, interview records, extrinsic information
Legal_Provision: Sections of Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations related to work permits and admissibility
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Intent to immigrate despite temporary application
Applicable_Process: Work permit application with assessment of residency intent
Outcome_of_Review: No violation of fairness or legal error found
